data.title: Kernel Archive: Re: Problems with VM
data.text:
Re: Problems with VM

From: Alan Cox (alan@lxorguk.ukuu.org.uk)

Date: Thu Feb 14 2002 - 19:47:24 EST

Next message: Douglas Gilbert: "Re: Compile error with linux-2.5.5-pre1 & advansys scsi" Previous message: Hans-Christian Armingeon: "fett sorry, die nummer von Gelinde war falsch!!!!" In reply to: ccroswhite@get2chip.com: "Problems with VM" Next in thread: J.A. Magallon: "Re: Problems with VM" Reply: J.A. Magallon: "Re: Problems with VM" Messages sorted by: [ date ] [ thread ] [ subject ] [ author ]

> as 'normal' ran. Consequently, I will have a machine that has 5M

> 'normal' RAM, 800M 'cache' RAM and the reset coming out of swap space.

> I need this 'cache' RAM placed back into the available RAM pool to be

> used by applications. Is there a patch/kernel configuration that I can

> change this behavior?

2.4.18-rc1 should fix the worst of that. The rmap patches in 2.4.18-ac

definitely fix it

-

To unsubscribe from this list: send the line "unsubscribe linux-kernel" in

the body of a message to majordomo@vger.kernel.org

More majordomo info at http://vger.kernel.org/majordomo-info.html

Please read the FAQ at http://www.tux.org/lkml/
